section.title: How to reRender only particular row(s) of dataTable?
section.para: If you use <rich:dataTable> then you may use ajaxKeys attribute to bind the rowKeys to be reRendered there. After you need to point reRender on the whole table and only specified rows will be reRedered. Also the example of usage of <a4j:repeat> component are available here.

section.title: Is it possible to create dynamic menu using <rich:dropDownMenu> component?
section.para: <rich:dropDownMenu> is a standard JSF component. So, creation of the menu dynamically from the Java Script code is the same as for any other jsf component.

section.title: Is it possible to customize the look of dataScroller (the forward/back buttons) and replace them with an images?
section.para: The answer is yes. Use facets: "first_disabled", "last_disabled", "next_disabled", "previous_disabled", "fastforward_disabled", "fastrewind_disabled".

section.title: How to customize simpleTogglePanel? I need to change an icon for a toggler.
section.para: To customize an icon for a toggler, use "openMarker" and "closeMarker" facets.

section.title: Can dropDownMenu be included in tree nodes?
section.para: The <rich:dropDownMenu> is designed keeping in mind that it should not be used for a contextMenu purpose. We have a <rich:contextMenu> component in the TODO list. However, it is not schedule for the nearest versions.

section.title: How to pass own parameters during a modalPanel opening or closing?
section.para: The answer could be found in the "Details of usage" of <rich:modalPanel> component.

section.title: How to add a link to the tree node?
section.para: Simple code is placed below:
section.programlisting: ... <rich:tree value="#{bean.data}" var="data"> <rich:treeNode type="text" nodeClass="customNode" acceptedTypes="file2" onselected="return false;"> <h:commandLink value="#{data.linkValue}" action="#{data.someAction}"/> </rich:treeNode> </rich:tree> ...

section.title: Is it possible to place tabs upright in the tabPanel?
section.para: It's not possible to place tabs upright in the tabPanel. For this purporse it's necessary to use togglePanel. Toggle controls can be placed anywhere in the layout.

section.title: How to get a commandButton working within the modalPanel?
section.para: Simple code is placed below:
section.programlisting: ... <rich:modalPanel> <f:facet name="header"> <h:outputText value="Test" /> </f:facet> <f:facet name="controls"> <h:commandLink value="Close" style="cursor:pointer" onclick="Richfaces.hideModalPanel('mp')" /> </f:facet> <h:form> <t:commandButton value="Test" action="#{TESTCONTROLLER.test}" /> </h:form> </rich:modalPanel> ...
